website_summaries.verdict: The Impossible I-1 is a modern instant camera with advanced tech, including manual control via Bluetooth, but it has some issues that are tough to ignore.
cons: Battery drains when not in use
Pop-up viewfinder takes some getting used to
Flash doesn't work when power is low

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - shockingly bad results
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this. I’ve used instax Leica sofort Fuji wide and even limo instant cameras but this terrible camera beats them all for appallingly rubbish quality photos. In bright sunshine every one of the 8 expensive film photos were black and so dark nothing could be seen. Pity the camera looks good and feels good to hold but if it cannot take a decent photo there’s zero point in buying it as the film is so expensive. Please don’t buy this camera it’s shockingly bad and is going to be sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Focus is hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: With the film so expensive, you'd expect, by having autofocus, that you'll have much fewer shots, not on focus. However, that's not the case. The focusing is terrible, it locks, but until you see the final result, you can't tell if it's on focus or not - and that can take about 10 minutes or more, to tell. That makes it impossible to redo the exact same moment.
customer_reviews.author: kkazakov

customer_reviews.title: Frog tongue broke off with first photo
customer_reviews.text: Frog tongue pulled out with first picture and base of camera actually snapped off. Was easy to put back on but the frog tongue was impossible to reinstall so that was that. First pack of film used all came out black. Second pack slightly better but cannot be used in low light at all.
customer_reviews.author: aoife

customer_reviews.title: Im so disappointed, ive got the warranty and if i could ...
customer_reviews.text: I have receieved a faulty camera and have tried to message the owner, no response. The camera’s photos all have streaks and are literally cut in half. Im so disappointed, ive got the warranty and if i could have a refund tomorrow and return it i would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed. First
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. First, I had to do the battery reset, when it arrived. From that point - I've had very intermittent success with images. For an ASA of 640, photos are typically very under-exposed or endure serious color shifts. The camera's remote software is pretty cool. The camera's flash seems very insufficient for the film --- outdoors, in bright sunlight, the camera does okay. Maybe my issues are film related - maybe it's the camera - I dunno - so I offered a conservative 3 star rating. I've seen much better results with a fuji instax camera.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT SHERMAN

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money. Fun and versatile camera.
customer_reviews.text: THis is a great instant camera!. The ergonomics are great, the bluetooth interface gives access to full manual control and lots of other creative modes. The lens quality is good and the new formulation film by Polaroid Originals is really good. As good as the old Time Zero film from Polaroid, although the development still takes much longer... what counts is picture quality and this camera and film combination is really excellent. At the present price, which is a fraction of the original, this camera is a steal. I bought a second one. Highly recommended! Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Abrate

customer_reviews.title: A fun and artsy camera
customer_reviews.text: The Impossible Project camera was almost an impossible project. Building an instant camera from the ground up was no small task. This camera is loaded with features. The film is an issue. It is more expensive than other instant films on the market, especially considering you only get eight pictures per pack vs the other manufacturer gives you ten. The picture quality varies from picture to picture. The color is light and sometimes murky. But with all this in mind, you can get some really nice artsy shots.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Capers

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this, it is very poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to buy this camera, and was thrilled when the price came down from $300 to $100. Unfortunately, it has been a horrible purchase. Focusing is impossible; even with the flash on, the images are dark; and, the third time I used it one of the pins that keep the viewfinder in place broke off. I have had better experience with a 50 year old Polaroid Land 100 camera that I found when I cleaned out my mother's house - it still take beautiful pictures! Save yourself headache (and heartache) and skip this baby.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve M Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: terrible Qual...
customer_reviews.text: terrible quality. so weak body. and difficult connect app, and use. so bad. so-so- bad. only good is camera look. all other thing are bad.
customer_reviews.author: Spiro

customer_reviews.title: Cool camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool camera. I like that I can connect it to my phone and set a timer. The picture quality could be a bit better though. It takes 600 film which isn’t cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssia

customer_reviews.title: Neat Camera
customer_reviews.text: The battery will drain when not in use. If you read the instructions it does state this. The camera is fun to use otherwise. Pictures come out pretty decent too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Very nice alternative to the more expensive cameras
customer_reviews.text: Gift for a friend but it was amazing. Far better than i expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charge. Red light turns on as if the ...
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Camera only needed a reset, like other buyers and customer support figured. Very quick response from the team. The camear is great! Doesn't charge. Red light turns on as if the camera is charging, however even after 8+ hours of charging the camera still doesn't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this twist on a classic camera. The app is so fun.
customer_reviews.author: cheloniophile

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Not the best battery life, but amazing Polaroid camera. A little confusing to get used to features and took a whole pack of random photos by accident but so fun now!
customer_reviews.author: Raxwell

customer_reviews.title: absolute piece of garbage!!! do NOT purchase this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has never worked as promised and now just spits out a dark photo every time. Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Neat little camera, still playing with it but Iam pleased
customer_reviews.author: wendy barker

customer_reviews.title: 1 major flaw
customer_reviews.text: Would be amazing, takes amazing polaroids, my models love them! unfortunately my sights don’t flip up for some reason. Looks like one of the springs that flips them up isn’t lined up and It’s just got them locked down
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: More like Impossible to take a good photo
customer_reviews.text: The worst. it broke in no time and took the worst photos. The autofocus never worked, the Bluetooth function is a joke, the battery life is pathetic, and the flash was never bright enough. I don't know who designed this camera but I'd prefer function over form. It looks cool but just doesn't work. I paid full price for this piece of sh*t and so much on film, I hate this camera please listen to me and buy any other Polaroid camera.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Dark pictures
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. No matter what I did the pictures turned out very dark.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Nice shopping experience!
customer_reviews.text: Great product in a reasonable price! Good design, nice manufacturing, and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: LAM Tim Wa

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with this product. It's an overly glorified 1970's camera that is WAY over-priced. The App does't sync with the camera. You have to reboot it to work and the picture-taking-quality is so poor. Don't let the clever looking design fool you like it did me. It's THAT disappointing. Not worth it, even at a $35.00 price point and it is selling for $300.00
customer_reviews.author: IL

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly bad. Battery life is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap. The battery is so bad that I can’t even get through 8 shots anymore. Have wasted £££ of missed or poorly exposed shots due to the flash not firing. Avoid at all costs!
customer_reviews.author: Neel

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: Ended up not working that great, printed pictures didn't come out great. Not worth the $$$
customer_reviews.author: Just A Review

customer_reviews.title: Good Way to Get Polaroids From Digital
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, although it may take a while to get the exposure down properly. Love the German-accented audio instructions on the app.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: my instan lab doesn't work. my photos aren't getting a white bar on the bottom of the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela A.

customer_reviews.title: Warning do not purchase this product
customer_reviews.text: Not one picture was developed correctly of two packages of film. Wasted money. Not a product I would recommend. Difficult to use. Need to use in dark cold area but followed all directions with no success. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: *KA*

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one.
customer_reviews.text: Really poor quality photos even for a Polaroid. Directions were also very confusing. Returned it actually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery drain is a significant problem
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this camera but, I hardly ever pick it up due to the battery drain issues. My first camera was defective and the battery would not hold a charge. The good news is that Impossible replaced it with a functioning camera. That bad news is that the camera drains the battery continuously. A fully charged battery will be down by 2-3 lights overnight. This is a known issue and one that does not have a fix. A polaroid should be a pickup and go camera and this one is not.
customer_reviews.author: Balen

customer_reviews.title: But the colored film images are not good. Brights are too bright
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Not sure if it is the device or the film? But the colored film images are not good. Brights are too bright, the darks are too dark. Sometimes the images are out of focus (which is really frustrating when you are paying so much for each photo) Pros: I love the IDEA of photos printed on Polaroid...!!. AND I DO enjoy the way the Black and White photos develop - If you do buy this. Buy Black and White 600 film and skip the colored stuff completely.
customer_reviews.author: Onalaska Farm Sanctuary

customer_reviews.title: horrible P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited that someone made this camera - and I could buy it for a reasonable price..... and then I did. Horrible POS. this camera has never worked the way it was promised - or how the instruction manual suggested. I have yet to get a clear picture. I have used both - old polaroid film... and their film.... an matter what - this camera blows. Do not buy. do not buy. do not buy. I have used their film in another Polaroid camera --- it wasn't awful. So if you must - buy a used Polaroid, but their film.... and avoid, at all costs, this crap camera.
customer_reviews.author: patrick thompson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely impossible
customer_reviews.text: Even at a clearance price of around $30 this was not worth it considering the expensive film. Camera is not well made, and has poor battery life. The first time we used it the black retractable thin plastic thing fell off the front. Only got one semi-recognizable photo out of it, the rest were just dark blurs. Overall a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Sashy

customer_reviews.title: 3 Bought Zero Worked
customer_reviews.text: First review I have ever written. I ordered three of these for xmas presents. Recipients tested all three and none of them worked! The main problem was that it wouldn't spit out the dark sheet that protects all the pictures. And it needs to do that before you can start printing pictures. Will be returning as soon as I have gathered all three (two of the kids live out of state). Big disappointment. Supplier was Common Goods.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Unzelman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of extra features vs. a Fuji Instax camera . The remote control features are excellent. This is built like a real camera - not like a toy. Used this camera and my daughter's Fuji Instax and prefer the pictures from this camera. The pictures from this camera have a much more authentic look and feel to them. The flash is also extremely powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Photobug 77

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk.
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these cameras, both ended up in the junk pile. Have nothing good to report, Impossible, you can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Violet Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget the film.
customer_reviews.text: You would think for the price they charge for this you would get at least one package of film!
customer_reviews.author: Billdatum

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It's beautifully designed and a great reinvention of the original instant cameras. It does take some time to get get used to taking photos with it, my first couple were blown out (just all white) but that's part of the fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Impossible 009001 I-1 Instant Camera - Black
product_meta.description:
THE ORIGINAL. REINVENTED. The I-1 is a camera unlike any you’ve seen before. It’s the first new camera in over a decade for the original Polaroid format. It’s the only instant camera that comes with a companion App for iOS and Android - connect the I-1 to your smartphone via Bluetooth to access a variety of essential creative tools. It’s also the only instant camera with an adaptive ring flash, which provides a soft, diffused light that’s perfect for portraits. Take full manual control of your instant exposures by adjusting shutter speed and aperture. Experiment with creative techniques like double exposure, and paint with light on instant film. Make beautifully lit, well-balanced analog photos in a wide variety of shooting conditions. The I-1 lets you do more with instant photography than was ever before possible. It turns your phone into a remote control for the camera, using Bluetooth to allow the two to communicate. Use the App’s Manual Mode to adjust the camera’s shutter speed, aperture, focus distance and flash strength, balancing exposure with the help of the built-in light meter. It’s perfect for atmospheric portraiture and landscape shots, or capturing trails of city light in long night-time exposures. The App also lets you use your phone to draw loops and waves of light onto a photo, or to superimpose two images onto a single piece of instant film for a dreamlike, unreal effect. You can even trigger a shot by making aloud noise, capturing a glass at the moment it shatters, or a portrait at the moment a laugh rings out.

BOX CONTAINS
One Impossible I-1 Camera
feature_bullets: The only new Polaroid instant photography camera in original format.
Easy to use "Point and Shoot Camera.
Advanced that doubles as a ring flash user interface
Bluetooth connectivity and app I-1 for the full manual control and creative

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK
